newsitem.title: USA: Netscape's to unveil Netcaster next week.
newsitem.headline: Netscape's to unveil Netcaster next week.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp on Monday said its internet "push" product, Netscape Netcaster, will be available to the public next week.
The first preview version of the software, which is a component of Netscape's Communicator software package, was unveiled to software developers today, Netscape said.
Netcaster will be available for public download from the Netscape Internet site next week.
Push technology allows Internet news organizations and entertainment sites to broadcast their programming to specific computer users interested in getting them.
Netcaster users can subscribe to and browse free "channels" of automatically delivered content, or anchor a favorite "channel" to one's desktop.
A number of content providers have already created channels that are available to Communicator users, the company said.

Netscape said the final shipping version of Netscape Communicator will be available by the end of the second quarter at a price of $59. A professional edition, which includes additional functions, is priced at $79.
